content.question: A rice grain is a fruit that encloses a seed. Most of the dry mass of a rice grain is starch. In rice plants, starch is produced by hydrolyzing sucrose and then linking the released glucose molecules together into starch (Figure 1). The optimal temperature range for starch synthase activity in a particular strain of rice is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>27</mtext><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext><mo>–</mo><mtext>3</mtext><mn>0</mn><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EEE@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. The optimal temperature range for sucrose synthase in the strain is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>3</mtext><mn>0</mn><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext><mo>–</mo><mtext>35</mtext><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EED@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Describe how temperatures above <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>35</mtext><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaae4maiaabwdacqGHWcaScaqGdbaaaa@3A14@</annotation> </semantics> </math> most likely affect the structure and function of the starch synthase in the particular strain. Using the information provided, predict the most likely consequences to starch content in mature rice grains if the rice is grown in an area where the average temperature during the growing season is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>33</mtext><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaae4maiaabodacqGHWcaScaqGdbaaaa@3A12@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

frqParts.text: A rice grain is a fruit that encloses a seed. Most of the dry mass of a rice grain is starch. In rice plants, starch is produced by hydrolyzing sucrose and then linking the released glucose molecules together into starch (Figure 1). The optimal temperature range for starch synthase activity in a particular strain of rice is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>27</mtext><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext><mo>–</mo><mtext>3</mtext><mn>0</mn><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EEE@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.
